question.body: Which of the following properly describes the phase of deglutition that is under voluntary control?

multiple_choice.choice: The uvula and soft palate move upward to close off the nasopharynx pushing the bolus toward the esophagus.
The tongue moves upward and backward and pushes the bolus.
Peristalsis propels the bolus toward the stomach.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The pharyngeal phase which pushes the bolus into the esophagus is under involuntary control of the deglutition center of the medulla oblongata.
Correct. The oral phase or buccal phase of swallowing is voluntary and occurs as the tongue moves the bolus toward the oropharynx.
Incorrect. The esophageal phase which uses peristalsis to propel the bolus toward the stomach is involuntary.
